info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central DuPage and west central Cook Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hinsdale, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downers Grove, Elmhurst, Lombard, Melrose Park, Maywood, Brookfield, Hinsdale, Westchester, La Grange, Summit, Burr Ridge, Oak Brook, Westmont, Bellwood, Forest Park, La Grange Park, Western Springs, River Forest, Lyons and Riverside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Illinois.
